articleinfo.releaseinfo: This is version 0.1 of the WFYD manual.

sect2.title: What is WFYD?
sect2.para: WFYD is a simple application that may be used to keep track of time spent on projects. It is meant to be as simple and feature-free as possible.

Features include:
Creating Projects Projects are names. A project contains one or more "entries".
Creating Entries
Entries are line items associated with a project. An entry consists of a start time, an amount of time spent, and a series of notes describing what happened during this period.
Nag WFYD can be configured to nag you on a scheduled basis to make a new entry or stop the current entry timer.

sect2.title: Working with WFYD
sect2.para:
When you first start WFYD, you see the Main window, as shown in .
WFYD Main Window
WFYD main window, with no projects created

The main window consists of five areas. There is a menu bar at the top of the window, a project list and a set of buttons below the menu bar, a notes entry window, and an entry list for the currently selected project. There is also a status bar at the bottom of the window.
When you start WFYD for the first time, the project list, the notes entry window, and the entry list will be empty.

You cannot add an entry unless a project is selected.
Add a new project by typing its name into the project list entry box.

To start an entry that will be applied to the currently selected project, click the Add button near the top left of the main window. When you do so, the button will display the current time spent on this entry in minutes. Clicking the button again will stop the timer and add the entry to the entry list for the currently selected project.

Notes typed into the notes field will be entered into the entry when the entry has been completed.
You can also start a new entry by typing into the notes box.
You can end an entry by pressing ctrl-G instead of clicking on the Add button.
The data related to this program is kept in a file in ~/.wfyd.dat.
